us.phonetic: /v. kənˈtræst, ˈkɑntræst; n. ˈkɑntræst/, (v. kən trast′, kon′trast; n. kon′trast)

example.eg: There wasn't enough contrast, so the TV image was hard to see.
example.egtrans: 对比度不够，因此电视图像不清晰。

example.eg: The contrast between their personalities created a lot of conflict.
example.egtrans: 他们个性截然不同，造成了很多冲突。

example.eg: Compared with the bright paintings, the black sketch contrasts sharply.
example.egtrans: 黑色速写与明快的绘画形成鲜明反差。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 形成反差, 显示出对比差异

example.eg: I love how the blue eyeliner contrasts with your brown hair and eyes.
example.egtrans: 我很喜欢那蓝色眼线与你褐发以及褐色眼瞳形成的鲜明对比。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…形成鲜明对比，与…互补

example.eg: Let me contrast the correct and incorrect posture for this dance.
example.egtrans: 让我来对比一下这个舞蹈正确和错误的姿态。

us.phonetic: /v. kənˈtræst, ˈkɑntræst; n. ˈkɑntræst/, (v. kən trast′, kon′trast; n. kon′trast)

example.eg: I'm always late but you, by contrast, are always on time.
example.egtrans: 我总是迟到，相反地，你却总是准时。

example.eg: I had to adjust the colour contrast on his television.
The article compares and contrasts the works of Plato and Aristotle.
Canada, in contrast, is a net energy exporter.
example.egtrans: 正相反，加拿大是一个能源净出口国。

example.eg: In contrast to his work so far, the project he just turned in was superb.
Her hair's jet black, in contrast with her daughter's blonde locks.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…相对照, 与…形成对比
